thread.section_title: Getting home tonight is going to be pretty horrific – Metro
thread.title: Getting home tonight is going to be pretty horrific
thread.title_full: Getting home tonight is going to be pretty horrific

author: Richard Hartley-Parkinson
title: Getting home tonight is going to be pretty horrific
text:
(Picture: Rex/Shutterstock) At this stage it’s probably easier if we just tell you which tube lines are working properly.
There are several closures or warnings of severe delays across the Tube network affecting the Circle, District, Hammersmith & City, Piccadilly, Victoria and TfL Rail lines.
That could have a knock-on on effect for the rest of the day, so you may want to consider planning your route home now.
Here’s what TfL’s got to say about the problems line by line:
Victoria Line : No service between Victoria and Brixton southbound and Brixton to Green Park northbound due to while we fix a track fault at Victoria. Tickets accepted on London Buses South West Trains, London Overground and Greater Anglia Severe delays on the rest of the line
Piccadilly Line : No service between Kings Cross and Hammersmith and between Acton Town and Uxbridge due to a shortage of trains.SEVERE DELAYS on the rest of the line Tickets are being accepted on local buses, Chiltern Railways, South West Trains and Great Northern. Use Metropolitan line for stations Rayners Lane to Uxbridge
Hammersmith and City Line : Severe delays due to an earlier customer incident. Shepherds Bush Market is closed
District Line : Severe delays between Barking and Upminster and between Earls Court and Richmond due to a signal failure earlier at Whitechapel Minor delays on the rest of the line.
Circle Line : Severe delays due to an earlier customer incident. Shepherds Bush Market is closed
.
.
